2. Hadrianus. Hadrian, the dilettante philosopher and art-patron, issued a rescript (preserved by J ustin Martyr Apol. i. 90, and quoted by Euseb. iv. 8, 9) in ΑΔ). 124, of similar purport to the letter of Trajan to Pliny. It was addressed to Minucius Fundanus the proconsul of , Asia, and was intended to secure for the Christiane a formal trial and to protect them from slanderous informers.
